SEARCH
Package au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.evaluation

Interface ResourceResolver

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefinitionResourceResolver, FhirResourceResolver
public interface ResourceResolver
Interface for resolving FHIR resources during single-resource FHIRPath evaluation.

This interface is designed for scenarios where only column expressions are needed without access to actual dataset views. It does not require the createView() method, making it suitable for:

  • Building filter expressions where only Column references are needed
  • Single-resource evaluation without DataSource dependencies
  • Search column building and similar use cases
See Also:
  • SingleResourceEvaluator

  • Method Details

    • getSubjectResourceCode

      @Nonnull String getSubjectResourceCode()
      Returns the subject resource code for this resolver.

      The subject resource is the primary resource type being queried, such as "Patient" in a query starting with Patient.name.given. This method supports both standard FHIR resource types (e.g., "Patient", "Observation") and custom resource types (e.g., "ViewDefinition").

      Returns:
      the subject resource type code

    • resolveSubjectResource

      @Nonnull ResourceCollection resolveSubjectResource()
      Resolves the subject resource for this context.

      The subject resource is the primary resource type being queried and evaluated against.

      Returns:
      a ResourceCollection representing the subject resource

    • resolveResource

      @Nonnull Optional<ResourceCollection> resolveResource(@Nonnull String resourceCode)
      Resolves a resource by its type code.

      This method returns an Optional containing a ResourceCollection. The behavior depends on the implementation:

      • For the subject resource, returns its ResourceCollection
      • For foreign resources with EMPTY strategy, returns a ResourceCollection with correct type information but lit(null) column value
      • For foreign resources with FAIL strategy, throws an exception
      • Returns Optional.empty() only if the resource type is truly unknown

      Important: Returning Optional.empty() will cause the FHIRPath evaluation to fall back to field traversal, which may not be the desired behavior for known resource types. Implementations should return an empty ResourceCollection (with correct type but null column) rather than Optional.empty() for known but unavailable resources.

      Parameters:
      resourceCode - the FHIR resource type code (e.g., "Patient", "Observation")
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the ResourceCollection if available
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if cross-resource references are not supported and the FAIL strategy is in use
